intro: Diaphoranthus fuscus, commonly known as the dark diaphoranthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from deep purple to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy, dark green surface. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and birds.
